articles.title: Better JavaScript Shell Scripting with Bun Shell
articles.description: Performance-focused server-side runtime Bun continues its rapid evolution with a side quest into the world of shell scripting by making it easier, cross-platform friendly, and less verbose. zx offers similar (but less integrated and focused) functionality to Node users, if you should prefer.
articles.author: Jarred Sumner (Bun)

articles.title: Announcing AdonisJS v6
articles.description: If you want a backend Web framework with amazing docs and packed with features, Adonis is a good choice. v6 is a big step forward moving to ESM by default, with more type safety overall (including for routes and middleware references), a new validation library, and more.
articles.author: Harminder Virk

articles.title: QuickJS: The Small, Embeddable JavaScript Engine
articles.description: Several years ago, Fabrice Bellard, the genius behind FFMPEG and JSLinux, built a tiny and complete JavaScript engine in C. It now supports ES2023 and its latest release adds top-level await in modules and its REPL, as well as support for some cutting edge JS features (changelog).
articles.author: Fabrice Bellard

articles.title: Web Components in Earnest
articles.description: This is.. epic! If you want to really get a walk through the journey of building an entire app using Web Components and JavaScript, this is it. The app in this case is simple, but complete, and the author shows off the realities of going all in with Web Components here.
articles.author: David Bryant Copeland

articles.title: ▶  An Alpine, HTMX, and Astro-Based Wordle App
articles.description: Popular dev YouTuber Jack demonstrates building a Wordle clone with a modern Alpine, HTMX and Astro-based stack. Or you can go straight to the code, if you prefer.
articles.author: Jack Herrington

articles.title: How to Start a React Project in 2024
articles.description: Robin explains the pros and cons of a few common approaches, including using Vite, Astro, and Next.js.
articles.author: Robin Wieruch

articles.title: Build a Next.js App in Storybook with React Server Components and Mock Service Worker
articles.description: How to develop, document, and test RSC apps in isolation, while using MSW to mock network requests.
articles.author: Michael Shilman

articles.title: Jint 3.0: A JavaScript Interpreter for .NET
articles.description: Run JavaScript within a .NET app and expose .NET objects and functions to JavaScript code. v3 arrives after seven years of work and is the most standards-compliant JS engine running entirely within .NET.
articles.author: Sébastien Ros

articles.title: Mutative: A Library for Efficient Immutable Updates
articles.description: A library for efficient immutable updates, boasting being 2-6x faster than naive handcrafted reducers, and even more than 10x faster than Immer. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Michael Lin

articles.title: React Email 2.0: Build Better Emails with React
articles.description: React Email is a collection of unstyled components for creating emails using JSX and React (this example shows you the basic idea).
articles.author: Gabriel Miranda (Resend)

articles.title: workerpool 9.1: Offload Tasks to a Pool of Workers
articles.description: A long established thread pool library that works not only on Node but also in the browser.
articles.author: Jos de Jong

articles.title: Microsoft TypeSpec: A TypeScript-Inspired Way to Define APIs
articles.description: A language for concisely describing cloud service APIs and generating other API description languages (e.g. OpenAPI), client and service code, docs, and more. Formerly known as CADL. – GitHub repo.
articles.author: Microsoft

articles.title: Partytown 0.9: Run Third Party Scripts in a Web Worker
articles.description: A way to run resource intensive scripts on a separate thread (in a web worker) to let the main thread remain responsive. GitHub repo.
articles.author: Partytown

articles.title: pretty-ms 9.0: Convert Milliseconds to Readable Strings
articles.description: 1337000000 → 15d 11h 23m 20s
articles.author: Sindre Sorhus

articles.title: nmea.js: A Library to Parse Maritime Electronics Data
articles.description: I’d never even heard of NMEA till now, but if you work with sonars, gyrocompasses, and similar marine electronics, this is for you.
articles.author: Bruno Vieira

articles.description: @npm_malware on Twitter/X shares malicious packages detected in real time.
JetBrains has opened up its Early Access Program for WebStorm 2024.1, its commercial JS/TS IDE.
📅 React Conf 2024 takes place this May 15-16 online and at Lake Las Vegas.
Astro 4.2 – The framework that never ceases to amaze.
Node.js 21.6.1 (Current) – A bug fix for Undici.
Puppeteer 21.9 – Now using Chromium 121.
Next.js 14.1, Qwik 1.4, Expo Router v3, Redux Toolkit 2.1

articles.title: 12 Modern CSS One-Line Upgrades
articles.description: Here’s a dozen CSS properties that are well worth knowing — these one-line upgrades will help reduce technical debt, remove unnecessary lines of JavaScript, and score some easy wins for user experience, too. Think things like object-fit, scroll-margin, accent-color, etc.
articles.author: Stephanie Eckles

articles.title: A Practical Introduction to Scroll-Driven Animations with CSS scroll() and view()
articles.description: Shows us how, with just CSS, we can add scroll animations that toggle shadows on navbars, reveal images, add so-called 'scrolly-telling', link up carousel elements, and more.
articles.author: Adam Argyle

articles.title: AI for Web Devs
articles.description: Austin has just published the last post in this eight part series on using AI in web development, covering prompt engineerings, security, deployment, and more.
articles.author: Austin Gil

articles.title: ▶  Modern CSS, The State of the Web, Safari's Progress, and More
articles.description: Jen Simmons, of the WebKit team, was a guest on Kevin Powell’s channel to talk about all things CSS, web standards, font-size-adjust, margin-trim, text-box-trim, text-box-edge, and of course, Safari.
articles.author: Kevin Powell

articles.title: Learn the :has() Selector by Example
articles.description: Five practical examples of how to use this selector. There’s a video running through things too if you’d rather that.
articles.author: Mojtaba Seyedi

articles.title: Fading Content using Transparent Gradient in CSS
articles.description: A nice effect, and one that’s easily realised.
articles.author: Amit Merchant

articles.title: Better Form UX with the field-sizing Property
articles.description: A look at how the field-sizing CSS property could improve web form user experience.
articles.author: Stephanie Stimac

articles.title: Design Better Pagination
articles.description: Andrew shares some pagination UI best practices along with some considerations for more complex needs. Lots of visuals here to help things along.
articles.author: Andrew Coyle

articles.title: Disable Browser Caching with Meta HTML Tags
articles.description: Worth knowing (or at least bookmarking).
articles.author: Cristian Sulea

articles.title: ✨ sparkly-text: A Small Web Component for Making Text Sparkle
articles.description: A cute effect that uses animated SVG under the hood. You can see a few examples in this post.
articles.author: Stefan Judis

articles.title: Design Systems Database: A Database of Best-in-Class Design Systems, Organized and Sorted by Components and Directories
articles.description: Useful for studying the public design systems of well-known technical teams (Adobe, GitHub, MailChimp, Shopify, etc.), divided into systems, directories, components, and blueprints. Handy stuff.
articles.author: Ilya Greben

articles.title: SVG Filter Maker: A GUI To Interactively Build SVG Filters
articles.description: Not to be confused with CSS filters, this is for building the much more complex SVG filters using the <filter> element and one or more of the many filter primitives.
articles.author: Christopher Kirk-Nielsen

articles.title: Wooden Toggles
articles.description: I’m sharing this HTML and CSS CodePen demo just for the skeuomorphic memories it evokes of the texture, depth and ‘rich Corinthian leather’ found in the early days of iOS.
articles.author: Nicolas Jesenberger

articles.title: Typeculator: A Different Approach to Generating Type Scales
articles.description: Based on something called the “Golden Thread” technique, which helps overcome problems like fractional values, challenges with multiple typefaces, etc.
articles.author: Alex Paul

articles.title: worker-timers: setInterval/setTimeout But for Unfocused Windows
articles.description: When a tab loses focus, any timers used within can be throttled. One solution is to use a Web Worker instead.
articles.author: Christoph Guttandin

articles.title: CSS 3D Clouds
articles.description: This striking demo (from a decade ago) has been doing the rounds this week — it set out to create 3D-like clouds using CSS, transforms, and a touch of JavaScript. The approach to create such a thing now might be a little different, but this result remains good. You can make fluffy clouds, stormy ones, or even go with an over-the-top Michael Bay approach. Repo here, and there’s a tutorial, if you want to look back at how it was put together.
articles.author: Jaume Sánchez
